alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Nottoway; Prince George; Sussex; Western Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Chesterfield, Nottoway, west central Prince George, Dinwiddie and eastern Amelia Counties, the City of Colonial Heights and the City of Petersburg through 615 PM EDT... At 515 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Spainville, or near Mannboro, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Colonial Heights, Blackstone, Crewe, McKenney, Moseley, Amelia Courthouse, Mannboro, Fort Lee, Virginia State University, Prince George, Nottoway, Dewitt, Matoaca, Spainville, Carson, Wilsons, Fort Pickett and Scotts Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Nottoway; Prince George; Sussex; Western Chesterfield
